page.title: 05AROUND SHERE 3
page.content: The bridge across Upper Street was built in 1914. The villagers crossed over from the Manor to get their vegetables. Today the bridge is unsafe for anyone to walk across it. Just down the road is The Well. It was built in 1886 with two corner seats. There is a chain hanging which used to have a cup on it. We talked to an old man who is 88years old and he said he used to use the cup when he came to school. Today the well is dry but local people are carrying out renovation works and it is hoped that in the near future water will be available from the well. Just over the road in Gomshall Lane look out for an extra wide door,it is as wide as four children. The door was used by the Village Stores for bulk stores like grain,it was carried from Gomshall Station,exactly one mile away
